results.title: The Last bastion
results.creator_credit: Network Ten (Australia), Brian Rosen and Chris Thomson
results.brief_description: Set in Australia in 1942 and concerning the threat of Japanese invasion, this is a drama about the characters and events of the time in Australian history in which the inner cabinet of Australia’s coalition war government played a major role. The distinguished cast includes Timothy West, Robert Vaughn, John Wood, Michael Blakemore, Warren Mitchell and Ray Barrett. David Williamson co-wrote the script.

results.title: The Laser: a light fantastic
results.creator_credit: CBS News, Isaac Kleinerman and Peter Poor
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “21st Century”.
The laser is a revolutionary invention which produces a useful form of light. The light we usually see is a combination of many frequencies, directions and phases. The laser however, produces coherent light; that is, all the light waves travel simultaneously in exactly the same direction and at exactly the same frequency. One day, laser light may have as many uses as electricity does today. Reporter: Walter Cronkite.

results.title: The Laser beam
results.creator_credit: Handel Film Corporation and Leo A. Handel
results.brief_description: Uses animation to explain the principle of the laser. Shows some of the applications of lasers in medicine, industry, communications, space exploration and the holograms that may lead to three-dimensional television. Traces the history of lasers and shows how emission spectra and lasers are related. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.brief_description: Uses aerial photography, topographic models and maps to show that the language of maps is composed of symbols representing natural and man-made features of the earth’s surface.

results.title: The Language of Japan
results.brief_description: Shows the history and development of the language of Japan, in both spoken and written forms. Defines and illustrates Japanese literary traditions, and shows the highly refined art form of calligraphy.

results.title: The Language of film: the technique of super 8 production
results.creator_credit: Playing With Time and Kit Hood
results.brief_description: Follows a group of 12-16 year old student filmmakers through the various stages of creating their own 8mm film. Looks at three major areas: pre-production (scriptwriting, props and equipment); production (camera shots, direction, actors, assistants); and post-production (editing, sound). Narrated by Linda Schuyler. Suitable for secondary level.

results.title: The Language of advertising (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: British Broadcasting Corporation and Michael Dibb
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Ways of seeing”.
One of a series of films by art critic and author, John Berger, which explores the ways in which we look at pictures. Shows how the images used in advertising and publicity are related to the tradition of oil painting, a connection which we fail to notice only because we are encouraged to believe that painting is fine art whereas publicity is simple commerce. Suitable for upper secondary and tertiary levels.

results.title: The Landscape architects; Fire down below
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Up a gum tree”.
The Landscape architects David Bellamy looks at how Aborigines learned to tame the countryside without becoming farmers, and at what sort of diet they enjoyed. “Fire Down Below” David Bellamy looks at the secrets of survival of the Australian flora against the frequent fires which seek to destroy.
